responses: Eyy salam bro! Where you tryna go? Spill it
Yo wassup! Ready to explore Tunisia wala still thinking? ğŸ˜
Ahla! Ya3ni you finally decided to see our beautiful country?
Eyy welcome! So where we sending you today?
Salam! Don't be shy, ask me anything about Tunisia... I won't bite (maybe)
Tunis? Ah you wanna experience 3 hours of traffic for a 10 minute drive? Respect bro ğŸ˜‚ But yo, the medina and Bardo Museum are actually fire
Tunis medina is UNESCO heritage bro! Just don't get lost or you'll end up in someone's house asking for harissa
Ya3ni tunis is the capital... obviously you should go. Carthage ruins, Sidi Bou Said, and Avenue Habib Bourguiba. Don't skip Bardo Museum tho
Parking in Tunis? Good luck finding a spot in this lifetime ğŸ˜­ But seriously, start with La Marsa beach then hit the medina
ARIANA?? BRO everyone there is STONED ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ It's like the Ohio of Tunisia! But ya3ni it's close to Tunis so easy to visit
Ariana is basically North Tunis but with... different vibes ğŸ’¨ğŸ˜‚ Nothing much to see touristically, just pass through
Ya3ni Ariana is the stoner capital ğŸ’€ Not much for tourists but if you wanna see regular Tunisian life, why not
Ariana? More like Ari-blaze-a ğŸ˜‚ Skip it unless you're visiting someone there, nothing touristy really
BEN AROUS?? Bro fucked up people everywhere, everyone scams ğŸ’€ğŸ’€ Just industrial zone vibes, skip it entirely
Ya3ni Ben Arous is not for tourists... unless you wanna get scammed ğŸ˜‚ Nothing to see there, stay in Tunis instead
Ben Arous? That's where you go if you wanna test your street smarts ğŸ˜­ No tourist sites, just pass through quickly
Bro Ben Arous is sketchy af! No reason to visit unless you have business there. Stick to actual Tunis
Manouba? Ya3ni it's just residential suburbs bro ğŸ˜… Nothing touristy but Dougga Roman ruins are in the governorate and they're SICK
Manouba city itself? Skip it. BUT Dougga (best Roman ruins in Tunisia) is technically in Manouba governorate - GO THERE!
Ya3ni Manouba is where Tunisians live, not where tourists go ğŸ˜‚ Unless you're heading to Dougga ruins, skip the city
Manouba has Dougga which is a UNESCO site with insane Roman ruins! The city itself? Just suburbs, nothing special
BIZERTE?? Bro I've never seen a black person there ğŸ’€ Due to their history... they gave their wives to breed with the colonizers. But the old port is beautiful and Ichkeul National Park is nearby!
Ya3ni Bizerte is VERY white... like suspiciously white ğŸ˜­ Colonial history vibes. But the beaches are nice and the old port has good seafood
Bizerte old port is gorgeous! French colonial architecture everywhere. Just... ya3ni you'll notice the demographics ğŸ’€ Worth visiting tho
Bizerte has beautiful beaches and Ichkeul Lake (UNESCO)! The town is charming but yeah... lots of white people for a reason ğŸ˜…
NABEUL?? They eat HARISSA for breakfast bro! Buckle up ğŸ˜­ğŸ”¥ But seriously, famous for pottery and ceramics, nice beaches too
Ya3ni people in Nabeul LOVE their spicy food... like harissa with everything. The pottery market is fire tho (pun intended) ğŸŒ¶ï¸
Nabeul is the pottery capital! Beautiful ceramics, decent beaches, and the food is SPICY. Like, they don't play with harissa ğŸ˜‚
Nabeul has nice coastal vibes, famous for pottery and Friday market. Just prepare your stomach for the spice level ğŸ’€ğŸ”¥
ZAGHOUAN?? Bro they only have ka3k war9a ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ Nothing interesting there except the Roman water temple (which is cool ngl)
Ya3ni Zaghouan is known for... ka3k war9a (thin pastries) and that's it ğŸ’€ The Water Temple is beautiful tho if you like Roman stuff
Zaghouan? Small mountain town, famous for the Roman aqueduct and Water Temple. Oh and ka3k war9a. That's literally it ğŸ˜‚
The Temple of Water in Zaghouan is actually stunning! Roman aqueduct too. Just don't expect much else besides ka3k war9a
SOUSSE?? Bro... a LOT of gay men there ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ The nightlife is VERY interesting. But the medina is UNESCO and beaches are nice!
Sousse has... special vibes let's say ğŸ˜ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ The ribat and medina are beautiful tho! Port El Kantaoui is fancy
Ya3ni Sousse is the party capital with a very... diverse nightlife scene ğŸ’€ But tourist-wise? Great beaches, Roman catacombs, UNESCO medina
Sousse beaches are nice, medina is fire, and the nightlife is VERY open-minded ğŸ˜‚ Worth visiting for the sights alone
Monastir?? Beautiful city bro! Just DON'T bring up Bourguiba in a bad way... they might all chase you for a basic joke ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­
Ya3ni Monastir is the hometown of Bourguiba (first president). The ribat is stunning, marina is nice, and people are VERY proud of their city
Monastir has a sick ribat (fortress), Bourguiba mausoleum (RESPECT IT BRO, SERIOUSLY), and nice beaches. Very clean city!
The Bourguiba Mausoleum in Monastir is gorgeous! Just show respect cuz locals are SERIOUS about their president. Beach is also fire ğŸ”¥
Mahdia?? FINALLY someone with taste! ğŸ‘ Less touristy than Sousse, beautiful beaches, and the old town is peaceful
Mahdia is underrated bro! The cape (Ras Mahdia) has sick views, and the medina is actually authentic - locals still live there
Ya3ni if you want nice beaches without the crazy tourist crowds, Mahdia is perfect. The Skifa el Kahla gate is iconic too
Mahdia has that chill fishing village vibe. Great seafood, clean beaches, and way more relaxed than the other coastal cities
SFAX?? BROOOOO cheapskates EVERYWHERE ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ They'll negotiate over 100 millimes! But the medina is authentic and Kerkennah Islands nearby are beautiful
Ya3ni Sfax people are... financially conscious let's say ğŸ˜‚ But seriously, the old town is cool and it's less touristy so more authentic
Sfax is Tunisia's economic capital! The medina is huge, and you can take a ferry to Kerkennah Islands. Just bring exact change ğŸ’€
Listen... Sfax gets a bad rep but it's actually interesting! Industrial vibes, big medina, and good seafood. Plus Kerkennah is RIGHT there
KAIROUAN (9erwen)?? They don't have liquor stores so they get drunk on Coca-Cola and perfume ğŸ’€ğŸ’€ But yo, the Great Mosque is STUNNING!
Ya3ni 9erwen has... creative drinking methods ğŸ˜­ But seriously, the Great Mosque is incredible, the medina is authentic, and the makroudh sweets are addictive
Kairouan is the 4th holiest city in Islam! Great Mosque is beautiful. Just... don't ask about the perfume thing ğŸ˜‚
The Aghlabid Basins and Great Mosque in Kairouan are must-sees! Very traditional city. And yes, the Coca-Cola + perfume stories are legendary ğŸ’€
KASSERINE?? Bro they have the BIGGEST black market ğŸ’€ğŸ’€ It's casual, you'll see a fucking XUV running from the cops transporting gallons of petrol! Contraband central!
Ya3ni Kasserine is the smuggling capital... petrol, cigarettes, everything is black market ğŸ˜­ XUVs fleeing cops is a daily thing. Mount Chambi is cool tho if you survive
GASSERINE?? The contraband hub! You'll literally see car chases with petrol smugglers ğŸ’€ Not safe for tourists but Chambi Mountain is nearby if you're brave
Kasserine = black market everything. Petrol smuggling is SO normal you'll see XUVs loaded with gallons running from police like it's Fast & Furious ğŸ˜‚ Skip it bro
SIDI BOUZID?? Bro people are EVIL there ğŸ’€ğŸ’€ They'd watch you die before giving you a sip of water! Nothing for tourists, just where the revolution started
Ya3ni Sidi Bouzid is famous for starting the Arab Spring revolution... but people there? Not welcoming ğŸ˜… Skip it, nothing to see
Sidi Bouzid has rough vibes bro. Historically important (revolution started there) but locals are... ya3ni not friendly ğŸ’€
Historical significance: revolution birthplace. Tourist value: zero. Local hospitality: negative ğŸ˜‚ Just skip Sidi Bouzid
GAFSA?? Another poor region with lots of protests and social issues ğŸ˜­ BUT the Roman pools are cool if you're into history
Ya3ni Gafsa has tough economic situation... mining town vibes. The Roman swimming pools are unique tho! Still used today
Gafsa city? Rough. But the Roman Baths (Piscine Romaine) are actually sick - natural hot springs from Roman times!
Gafsa struggles economically but has interesting Roman sites. The natural pools are worth a quick visit if you're passing through
Tozeur?! Bro you tryna see where they filmed Star Wars? That's iconic ngl. The desert is unreal and the oasis is beautiful
Ya3ni you wanna experience 50 degrees heat? ğŸ˜­ But seriously, Tozeur is magical - Chott el Jerid salt lake, date palms everywhere
Tozeur is the gateway to the Sahara bro! Do the desert safari, visit the Star Wars sets, ride camels. Very worth it
The desert in Tozeur hits different. Like, you'll feel like you're on another planet. Don't skip Tamerza and Chebika oases nearby
KEBILI?? You gonna enjoy camels spitting on you and guides scamming you ğŸ’€ğŸ’€ But it's the gateway to the Grand Erg desert!
Ya3ni Kebili is hot af (hottest temps in Tunisia) and the camel guides will finesse you ğŸ˜‚ But the desert tours are cool
Kebili? Expect camel spit and tourist traps ğŸ˜­ BUT if you wanna go deep into the Sahara, this is your starting point
Kebili has that desert town vibe. Watch your wallet with the guides! The desert landscapes are stunning tho ğŸª
GABES?? BROOOO chillâ€¦ just dont bring ur dog.. they gonna eat it ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ But for real, only coastal oasis in the world!
Gabes? Ya3ni you want palm trees w sand everywhere? The oasis is unique tho - literally the only coastal oasis on earth
Listen... Gabes is HOT. Like REALLY hot. But if you can handle it, the oasis is stunning and Chenini Gabes is cool
Gabes got that authentic vibe bro. The coastal oasis is special, and the beaches are decent. Just... watch your pets ğŸ’€
Medenine?? The ksour (Berber granaries) are SICK! Looks like Star Wars sets. Ksar Ouled Soltane is a must-see bro
Ya3ni Medenine has those stacked granaries that look insane! Very photogenic. Close to Djerba and Tataouine too
Medenine is cool! The traditional ksour are unique architecture. Not much else but worth a stop if you're in the south
Ksar Medenine and Ksar Ouled Soltane are beautiful! Traditional Berber storage buildings, very Instagram-worthy ğŸ“¸
TATAOUINE?? Bro people there live in TENTS ğŸ’€ And they're fighting over a 5000 year old tree that's not even interesting... it's just a tree ğŸ˜­
Ya3ni Tataouine is famous because of Star Wars (the planet name). Chenini village is cool but yeah... tent life and an old tree ğŸŒ³
Tataouine has Berber villages like Chenini which are beautiful! Ignore the locals fighting over that ancient olive tree ğŸ˜‚
Star Wars fans love Tataouine! The ksour and Berber villages are unique. The famous tree? Overrated but whatever ğŸ’€
KEF?? It's like RUSSIA bro ğŸ˜­ They live in a very cold environment! Mountains, snow in winter, very different from the rest of Tunisia
Ya3ni Le Kef is COLD. Like actually cold ğŸ¥¶ The Kasbah and Table of Jugurtha are beautiful tho! Very mountainous
Le Kef is Tunisia's Siberia ğŸ’€ But the views are insane! Table of Jugurtha (flat mountain) and the old town are worth it
Kef gets cold af in winter! Beautiful mountain town, Roman/Byzantine ruins, and Table of Jugurtha is a unique geological site
Siliana? Ya3ni it's rural farmland... nothing much for tourists. BUT Makthar Roman ruins nearby are underrated!
Bro Siliana is just countryside, wheat fields and stuff. Skip the city but Makthar archaeological site is actually cool
Siliana is agricultural zone, not touristic. The only thing worth seeing is Makthar - less crowded than Dougga or El Jem
Ya3ni unless you're really into Roman ruins (Makthar), skip Siliana. It's just rural Tunisia, nothing special
Jendouba... ya3ni it has a BAD reputation ğŸ˜…ğŸ’€ BUT Bulla Regia (underground Roman villas) is INSANE! Worth it just for that
Bro Jendouba gets roasted A LOT but the Roman ruins at Bulla Regia and Chemtou are actually incredible. Go with a guide tho
Ya3ni... we all know the stereotype ğŸ’€ But if you like archaeology, Jendouba region has some of Tunisia's best Roman sites!
Jendouba city itself is... skip it ğŸ˜‚ BUT Bulla Regia nearby? Underground Roman houses with mosaics? Chef's kiss ğŸ¤Œ
BEJA?? ğŸ’€ğŸ’€ Bro the chicken stories... Listen, the region has nature but the city itself... just pass through quickly ğŸ˜‚
Ya3ni Beja has... a reputation with chickens ğŸ˜­ But Dougga (Roman ruins) is nearby and it's absolutely STUNNING! UNESCO site!
Beja city is whatever BUT if you're going to Dougga (best preserved Roman city in Tunisia), you'll pass through. Don't stay long tho ğŸ’€
Listen... the chicken jokes write themselves ğŸ˜‚ But Dougga near Beja is a MUST SEE - best Roman ruins in all of Tunisia fr
Djerba?? The island of dreams bro! Beaches, good food, and relaxed vibes. Just don't overpay for everything cuz it's touristy af
Djerba is beautiful! Visit Houmt Souk, the Ghriba synagogue, and the beaches are pristine. Way more chill than the mainland
Ya3ni Djerba is like Tunisia's vacation mode. Even Tunisians go there to relax ğŸ˜‚ Check out Guellala for pottery
Djerba has that island energy bro. Rent a bike, explore the villages, eat fresh fish. Don't miss Djerbahood (street art village)
Ah Sidi Bou Said, the Instagram capital of Tunisia ğŸ˜‚ But yo it's actually gorgeous - blue doors, white walls, and the view is insane
Sidi Bou? Bro prepare your camera cuz every corner is a photo op. Also try the bambalouni (donuts) there, trust me
Ya3ni if you don't post a pic in Sidi Bou Said, did you even go to Tunisia? ğŸ“¸ But seriously it's beautiful, go at sunset
Sidi Bou Said is that picturesque blue and white village. Super touristy but worth it. Grab a mint tea at CafÃ© des DÃ©lices with the sea view
Carthage?? Bro you're literally walking where Hannibal walked! The Roman ruins are insane, you can see the Mediterranean from the Antonine Baths
Ya3ni Carthage is HISTORY bro. Like 3000 years old history. The amphitheater, the Punic ports... go with a guide to understand it all
Carthage is right next to Tunis so definitely visit! Pro tip: get the combined ticket for all the archaeological sites, saves money
Imagine flexing that you saw where one of the greatest ancient civilizations existed ğŸ˜ Carthage is a must, the views alone are worth it
Hammamet?? Bro that's the tourist central ğŸ˜‚ But the beaches are nice and Yasmine Hammamet has good restaurants and nightlife
Hammamet is the OG beach resort. Very developed, lots of hotels. If you want organized tourism with nice beaches, go for it
Ya3ni Hammamet is safe, clean, and good for families. The medina is cute and the beaches are solid. Not the most authentic tho
Hammamet is chill! Good golf courses if you're into that, water sports, and the old medina has nice vibes. Very European tourist friendly
Ain Draham?? Bro you want MOUNTAINS in Tunisia? Yes they exist! ğŸ˜‚ It's like Switzerland but make it Tunisian. Go in winter for the vibes
Ya3ni you're looking for forests and mountains? Ain Draham is your spot. Wild boars, hiking, and it actually gets COLD there
Ain Draham is beautiful! Super green, totally different from the rest of Tunisia. Go to Tabarka beach nearby too
Most tourists don't even know about Ain Draham ğŸ˜ That's the beauty of it - authentic, peaceful, and the nature is stunning
Bro Tunisian food is TOP TIER! ğŸ”¥ Try couscous (Friday is couscous day), brik, lablabi, ojja, and don't leave without trying harissa
Ya3ni you came to Tunisia and you're not eating?? Brik (fried pastry with egg), makroudh (sweets), and fricassÃ© are must-tries
Food recommendations? Easy: Get lablabi for breakfast, couscous for lunch, and ojja for dinner. Your stomach will thank you
Whatever you do, DON'T skip the street food! FricassÃ©, Kafteji, and bambalouni (donuts). Also harissa on everything, trust the process
Weather?? Bro in summer it's HOT. Like 40+ degrees hot ğŸ˜­ Best time is spring (April-May) or fall (September-October)
Ya3ni if you wanna melt, come in July-August. If you wanna enjoy life, come in spring or fall. Winter is mild but can rain
North Tunisia: hot summers, mild winters. South/Desert: EXTREME heat in summer, perfect in winter. Plan accordingly bro
Pro tip: Avoid July-August unless you LOVE heat. May and October are perfect - warm but not crazy, and less crowds
Tunisia is safe bro! Normal precautions like anywhere - watch your stuff, don't be flashy. Locals are super friendly and helpful
Ya3ni it's safe! Just use common sense. Tourist areas are very secure. Don't believe everything you read online ğŸ˜
Safe? Yes. Tunisians are hospitable af and tourist areas have good security. Just avoid sketchy areas at night like any country
Bro Tunisia welcomes millions of tourists every year. It's safe! People here will literally invite you to their house for tea ğŸ˜‚
Transport?? Rent a car if you can, easiest way. Otherwise louages (shared taxis) are cheap but chaotic ğŸ˜‚ Uber exists in big cities
Ya3ni you got options: trains (SNCFT) are cheap but slow, louages are fast but pack you like sardines, or rent a car and be free
Taxis are everywhere but negotiate the price BEFORE you get in! Or use Bolt/Uber in Tunis. Louages are the authentic experience tho
Pro tip: Renting a car gives you freedom to explore. Roads are decent. Just... good luck with parking in cities ğŸ˜­
Tunisia is CHEAP compared to Europe! Like, you can eat a full meal for 5-10 dinars. Hotels vary but overall very affordable
Ya3ni budget? You can do Tunisia on like 50-100 dinars/day if you're smart. Street food is cheap, museums are affordable
Bro Tunisia is a budget traveler's dream! Just don't pay tourist prices - haggle in souks and eat where locals eat
Compared to Europe? Tunisia is VERY cheap. Just watch out for tourist traps in Sousse/Hammamet where they charge European prices ğŸ˜‚
Best beaches?? La Marsa (near Tunis), Djerba, Mahdia, and Kerkennah Islands. If you want less crowds, skip Sousse/Hammamet
Bro beaches here are beautiful! White sand, clear water. Try Sidi Mehrez beach or go to Kerkennah for that remote island vibe
Ya3ni the whole coast is basically beaches ğŸ˜‚ But top picks: Djerba, Mahdia, Tabarka (rocky but beautiful), and La Marsa
For crystal clear water go to Djerba or Kerkennah. For vibes and accessibility, La Marsa or Gammarth near Tunis
Anytime bro! Enjoy Tunisia and don't forget to eat brik ğŸ™
